Title: Mac Tip: Adding Folder Stacks to the Dock
Author: Corey Schafer
Project_desc: It’s easy for your dock to become cluttered with applications (E.g. Text editors, the Adobe suite, your Mac applications). It is possible to organize your applications into a single folder on the dock for easy access.

Title: Understanding Binary, Hexadecimal, Decimal (Base-10), and more
Author: Corey Schafer
Project_desc: An introduction to binary and hexadecimal numbers. In this video, we will learn how to better understand binary and hexadecimal numbers. First, we will go over the base-10 system that we use on a daily basis. Once we grasp how a base-10 system is calculated, it will be much easier for us to understand how binary, hexadecimal, base-8, or any other base-n number is calculated.

Title: Sublime Text 3: Setup, Package Control, and Settings
Author: Corey Schafer
Project_desc: In this video, we’ll do a quick walkthrough on setting up a development environment using Sublime Text 3.

Title: WordPress Tips: Test your theme with Theme Unit Test and Monster Widget
Author: Corey Schafer
Project_desc: When I first started developing WordPress sites, I found myself constantly adding dummy data so I could get an idea for how specific elements would look with my theme. Manually adding dummy data was not only slow, but it was also easy to leave out a lot of different test cases.

Title: WordPress Plugins: Imsanity
Author: Corey Schafer
Project_desc: Imsanity is my favorite WordPress Plugin for keeping large image sizes under control.

Title: Mac Tip: Screenshots
Author: Corey Schafer
Project_desc: I am frequently taking screenshots of what I am doing on screen. It’s useful to know all the options you have in order to make this quick and simple. In this video, I’ll go over the different ways in which you can take some basic screen shots on your Mac, and look a few advanced techniques as well.

Title: ArcGIS API for JavaScript: Starting Templates
Author: Corey Schafer
Project_desc: This is the second part of a multi-part series on using the ArcGIS API for JavaScript. In this walkthrough, we will take a look at some of the ESRI starting templates for our web map.

Title: Terminal 101: Creating Aliases
Author: Corey Schafer
Project_desc: In this quick tip, we’re going to look at how to create aliases for common terminal commands. If you find yourself typing in the same commands over and over, then it is a good indication that you should write an alias for that. Title: Mac Tip: Windows’ Best Features on Mac with HyperDock
Author: Corey Schafer
Project_desc: I work on both Windows and Mac machines. I am a huge fan of developing on my Mac, BUT I do find myself missing certain features from Windows. Mainly the windows snapping feature, and the ability to quickly preview open applications on the taskbar/dock.

Title: ArcGIS API for JavaScript Part 1: First Web Map
Author: Corey Schafer
Project_desc: This will be the first part of a multi-part series on how to use the ArcGIS API for JavaScript. In this video, we will start by setting up a basic web map with HTML, JavaScript, and CSS. Unlike the samples on the ArcGIS website, we will separate out our scripts and stylesheets so that our application will be easier to maintain as it grows.
